Samiullah Shinwari run out (†Anamul Haque/Rubel Hossain) 81 (69b 10x4 1x6 94m) SR: 117.39

dismissalComment.html: oh it's a run out! Stanikzai couldn't connect with the ball that kept low outside off and Shenwari came across for a run meanwhile. The keeper passes the ball to the bowler and both batsmen are caught at the same end. Shenwari gets a lot of pats on his back as soon as he crosses the boundary rope

headshotImage.caption: Karim Sadiq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Karim Sadiq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he has fallen under pressure! Sunny bowled a slightly slower one towards middle, Sadiq played the shot a bit early while pushing it back and a leading edge from close to the sticker of the bat went back to the bowler for an easy catch

oh the ball's gone through him! Najibullah came down the track as the ball pitched around leg and was angled towards middle, and he played with a strange angle of the bat, keeping it horizontal, and the ball went right through. He couldn't get anywhere close to it
one more falls! Mominul pitched it up outside off, turned it away and the batsman drove with a lot of force only to give an outside edge to first slip where Nasir took a sharp catch

dismissalComment.html: oh the ball's gone through him! Najibullah came down the track as the ball pitched around leg and was angled towards middle, and he played with a strange angle of the bat, keeping it horizontal, and the ball went right through. He couldn't get anywhere close to it

headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal run out (Naeem Islam) 24 (33b 3x4 0x6 33m) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: it's a run-out! Afghanistan lose another one and this was a bit unnecessary. The batsman dabbed this one towards cover and thought about a single. By the time he was sent back by the non-striker, the fielder had come in, swooped the ball and fired a quick throw to the keeper. The leg umpire didn't even think about asking the third umpire..

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mominul Haque
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Nasir Hossain b Mominul Haque 7 (15b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 46.66

dismissalComment.html: one more falls! Mominul pitched it up outside off, turned it away and the batsman drove with a lot of force only to give an outside edge to first slip where Nasir took a sharp catch

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari run out (†Anamul Haque/Rubel Hossain) 81 (69b 10x4 1x6 94m) SR: 117.39

dismissalComment.html: oh it's a run out! Stanikzai couldn't connect with the ball that kept low outside off and Shenwari came across for a run meanwhile. The keeper passes the ball to the bowler and both batsmen are caught at the same end. Shenwari gets a lot of pats on his back as soon as he crosses the boundary rope

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque b Samiullah Shinwari 50 (72b 6x4 0x6 104m) SR: 69.44

dismissalComment.html: that's gone through Mominul, Shenwari gets rid of the set batsman! He sent down a legspinner around off, Mominul came down the track to drive but missed the line of the ball because of the turn and the ball hit the middle stump. The umpires are checking for the no ball now, no angles are conclusive because there are fielders on either side of the pitch blocking the path of the cameras. So we can't see clearly where the foot lands, but he seems fine and Mominul walks back

dismissalText.commentary: Ziaur Rahman b Mohammad Nabi 41 (22b 4x4 3x6 34m) SR: 186.36

dismissalComment.html: gets the of stump! Nabi has done it, Ziaur took a step down to drive it on off, the ball spun in from just outside off and went through Ziaur's gate to hit the off stump. Afghanistan celebrate, onre wicket to go

oh Nabi has struck with some sharp turn, stunned silence in the ground! He flighted it by pitching it just outside off, Mushfiqur was on the move as he tried to turn it to leg but missed and was struck in front of the off stump for a loud appeal as the ball turned and the finger went up. The captain has to go back

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak run out (Najibullah Zadran) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: full delivery is driven down the ground and mid-off cuts it to one. Oh wait, he has a direct hit and looks like the batsman was lazy to make his ground. Bowden refers to third umpire. Replays show Razzak did not ground his bat even though he had made it and his bat was in the air when the ball hit the stumps. That's very irresponsible from a player who has played nearly 150 ODIs

dismissalComment.html: oh three wickets in three balls! Zadran pitched it down leg and Sunny wanted to play it off his hips but only managed a thin edge to the keeper who goes up, and so does the umpire's finger

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot
off side drive on front foot

dismissalText.long: c Nawroz Mangal b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain c Nawroz Mangal b Mohammad Nabi 17 (19b 2x4 0x6 39m) SR: 89.47

commentTextItems.html: it's all over, Afghanistan have won, a landmark day for their cricket, the final wicket came after a swipe to midwicket, fielder gets under it and there's no fumbling this time

commentPostTextItems.html: Mushfiqur Rahim: We were outplayed in all three departments. We played well earlier in the first 30 overs but they did well thereafter, especially in the slog overs. They batted very well and didn't gave us any chance and we were one bowler short. 254 was chasable, we could have batted better but they bowled well too. Bowling was ok, but they batted really well in the end. Shakib and Tamim aren't there so there was a lot of pressure, I tried to bat well but I got out cheaply. Hard luck to the boys. It's hard to believe that we disappointed the fans but we'd want to improve in the remaining matches.

Mohammad Nabi: Our first win against a Full Member. They bowled very well till 25th over, and the last partnership was brilliant. It was a good partnership. Our boys bowled brilliantly in the first few overs and fielded well. We missed some catches towards the end…Fans and the whole country must be celebrating and inshallah we'll try to do even better in the coming matches. Our fans have always prayed for us and they love us so I'd like to thank them.

Samiullah Shenwari is the Man of the Match: It was a team effort…from the coach, manager and everyone. We wanted to bat till 50 overs and I did. 150 was the big partnership, our plan was to just stay at the wicket and when we took 107 runs from the last 10 overs, that was the main point. I have learnt legspin from the beginning and have been working hard with the coaches.

9.47pm That's a historic win for Afghanistan, their first ODI victory against a Test-playing nation and their 17th ODI win overall. They were in tatters at one point of time, at 90 for 5, but Shenwari and Stanikzai revived and charged them to 254. Shapoor Zadran and Hassan started very well when they bowled, with early wickets. But Mominul replied with some fireworks and was followed by Nasir's 41 before Ziaur's 22-ball 41, which gave Afghanistan a scare. But Nabi struck again and again and finished it off in the 48th over for the epic win. They will never forget this day, what a journey they have had. That's all we have for you from this historic win, it's Vishal Dikshit signing off for now, bye bye!

Hamid Hassan : Amazing win, thanks to god. Congratulations to all Afghanistan people around the world. First time we have beaten a Test-nation side. Everyone worked very hard and that's why we won. Feel very proud because we have been playing only for last 10 years and other teams have been playing for much longer, so very very happy. I pulled a muscle and was praying that we would win when I was sitting out.

commentTextItems.html: full toss on the pads, pushed towards midwicket
drilled towards long-off this time for a single
length ball from Nabi, Rubel looks to swipe that out of the ground, can only get it as far as short fine leg
full toss outside off, he takes the injured hand off the bat and no time for a single as he jabs to point. Just one from the over

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: tries to drive outside off but misses again
just past the outside edge as Sohag poked but missed. Oh wait, the keeper passed the ball to his team-mate and they still ran a bye, but the umpire says the ball was dead by then
almost in the block hole outside off, jabbed to point for a quick single
low full toss outside off, drives to cover but can't middle it

commentPreTextItems.html: Zuber: "Cricket lovers always want a new upcoming team to win, so that more non-cricket countries are encouraged and progress of cricket increases."

commentTextItems.html: full ball on off, driven down to mid-off
fuller on off, turned to midwicket from off and that's just three singles in the over

commentTextItems.html: another dot ball as he defends it back to Nabi
flat and short of length on off, whipped to deep midwicket for one more
turns the length ball on off towards midwicket
short of length ball steered to deep backward square leg for one

commentPreTextItems.html: There were a lot of discussions between Mangal and Nabi in between the overs. 39 form 30, one wicket to go

commentTextItems.html: flighted delivery on off, defended off the front foot
full toss is edged to the keeper but lands in front of him

The keeper passes the ball to the bowler and both batsmen are caught at the same end. Shenwari gets a lot of pats on his back as soon as he crosses the boundary rope

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque lbw b Hamid Hassan 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw and Bowden's crooked finger goes up! He angled it in from length around off and it hit the batsman in front of the leg stump, Bowden took his time for the decision, but from the first look it looked like it would have missed the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shamsur Rahman b Shapoor Zadran 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh what a beauty, that went right through Shamsur! Length delivery on the off stump nips in a tad and goes through the defence of the batsman, who played for the angle of the ball. The off stump goes for a walk, Shapoor roars and is mobbed by his team-mates

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque b Samiullah Shinwari 50 (72b 6x4 0x6 104m) SR: 69.44

dismissalComment.html: that's gone through Mominul, Shenwari gets rid of the set batsman! He sent down a legspinner around off, Mominul came down the track to drive but missed the line of the ball because of the turn and the ball hit the middle stump. The umpires are checking for the no ball now, no angles are conclusive because there are fielders on either side of the pitch blocking the path of the cameras. So we can't see clearly where the foot lands, but he seems fine and Mominul walks back

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim lbw b Mohammad Nabi 23 (42b 1x4 0x6 73m) SR: 54.76

dismissalComment.html: oh Nabi has struck with some sharp turn, stunned silence in the ground! He flighted it by pitching it just outside off, Mushfiqur was on the move as he tried to turn it to leg but missed and was struck in front of the off stump for a loud appeal as the ball turned and the finger went up. The captain has to go back

dismissalText.long: c Samiullah Shinwari b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Samiullah Shinwari b Mirwais Ashraf 41 (60b 1x4 1x6 75m) SR: 68.33

dismissalComment.html: fifth catch offered by Nasir and this time it's taken! It was a short of length ball well outside off, Nasir stayed back and chopped it straight into the hands of Shenwari at backward point. Big wicket for Afghanistan

dismissalComment.html: one more wicket falls in the Powerplay! Naeem came down the track and drove the length ball powerfully towards mid-off where Nawroz Mangal dived to his right for a good catch. It was going fast and flat

headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak run out (Najibullah Zadran) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: full delivery is driven down the ground and mid-off cuts it to one. Oh wait, he has a direct hit and looks like the batsman was lazy to make his ground. Bowden refers to third umpire. Replays show Razzak did not ground his bat even though he had made it and his bat was in the air when the ball hit the stumps. That's very irresponsible from a player who has played nearly 150 ODIs

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Arafat Sunny c †Mohammad Shahzad b Shapoor Zadran 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh three wickets in three balls! Zadran pitched it down leg and Sunny wanted to play it off his hips but only managed a thin edge to the keeper who goes up, and so does the umpire's finger

dismissalText.long: c Nawroz Mangal b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain c Nawroz Mangal b Mohammad Nabi 17 (19b 2x4 0x6 39m) SR: 89.47

dismissalComment.html: it's all over, Afghanistan have won, a landmark day for their cricket, the final wicket came after a swipe to midwicket, fielder gets under it and there's no fumbling this time

milestones.description: Samiullah Shinwari and Asghar Afghan's 164-run partnership is AFG's highest for the 6th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 86 between Samiullah Shinwari and Raees
Shapoor has broken the record for most ducks (3) in ODIs for AFG, going past Karim Sadiq's 3
Mohammad Nabi has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (29) for AFG, going past Samiullah Shinwari

stories.title: Shenwari's blitz helps Afghanistan topple Bangladesh

Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced. refer to Appendix 6 Final Match or Series If no result is achieved in a final the match shall be declared drawn. In the event of a drawn final, the teams will be declared as Joint Champion and the prize money will be shared equally between the two competing teams.
